title: TAGN Fantasy Critic League 2025 – Week Twenty-Five and Death Stranding 2
description: Welcome to July!  I am couple days late on the usual weekly post, which I have done every Sunday up until this point, but I had places to be over the weekend, so some things fell by the wayside.  Also, the month in review post gets the last day of the month, so even though […]
author: Wilhelm Arcturus
excerpt: Welcome to July! I am couple days late on the usual weekly post, which I have done every Sunday up until this point, but I had places to be over the weekend, so some things fell by the wayside. A…
text: Welcome to July!  I am couple days late on the usual weekly post, which I have done every Sunday up until this point, but I had places to be over the weekend, so some things fell by the wayside.  Also, the month in review post gets the last day of the month, so even though I was home yesterday, this post got pushed a day further. Fantasy Critic League – Like Fantasy Football, but for Video Games This past week saw the release of another big title, Death Stranding 2, a sequel to a popular and well regarded game.  So we get to see how a big sequel does.  But first, the scores as they stood at last check-in. The Standings for Week 24 Okay, with that laid out, let’s look at what happened in week twenty-five.  A game shipped! Death Stranding 2: On the Beach has released! [Picked by Rodent Entertainment (Arhanta)] Now has a score of 91.2 I had to mix up two updates to get that one just to show where the scoring started.  However, it saw a bit of decline not too far down the road. Death Stranding 2: On the Beach [Picked by Rodent Entertainment (Arhanta)] Score has gone DOWN from 91.2 to 89.7 Still, that is an extremely solid score.  Arhanta was down in 10th spot with only two releases on the board, so that nearly 20 points was an automatic elevation. Publisher Score Updates Rodent Entertainment (Arhanta) Score has gone UP from 14.5 to 35.2 Moved from 10th place to 7th place Slightly Scuffed Studios (Kluwes) Moved from 7th place to 8th place TAGN HQ (Wilhelm) Moved from 8th place to 9th place Rusty Shackleford (Shilgrod) Moved from 9th place to 10th place That put Arhanta in seventh place, pushing three of us down the ranks and left the scoreboard looking like this at the end of the week. The Standings for Week 25 Bhagpuss remains solidly in first place for now, with six solid picks and a counter pick that won’t hurt him.  The projections changed up a little bit.  Oddly, Arhanta got dinged a rank even as Death Stranding 2 delivered.  Part of me is as interested in how accurate the projections will end up being. We also had some updates this week, with titles getting their releases pinned down. Little Nightmares III [Picked by Rodent Entertainment (Arhanta)] Release date changed from ‘2025’ to ‘Friday, October 10, 2025’. Chained Echoes: Ashes of Elrant [Picked by Crash and Burn Games (Shawn)] Release date changed from ‘Q2 2025’ to ‘Thursday, August 07, 2025’. Always good to have a real release date.  However, the news wasn’t universally positive. Dave the Diver – In the Jungle [Picked by Rodent Entertainment (Arhanta)] Estimated release date changed from ‘Late 2025’ to ‘Early 2026’. That puts Dave the Diver out of the running for this year’s league.  Time to drop and pick something else. Then we had one bid this week. Keeper Won by Hare Brained Schemes (p0tsh0t) with a bid of $11 Keeper has a mid-October release date. With all of that, here is what is coming up. Coming up for week 26 Basically, we’ve got nothing for the US Independence Day week.  So any score changes will be driven by reviews.  Expect next week’s update to be light unless we get a surprise. Related: TAGN Fantasy Critic League TAGN Discord Server Fantasy Critic Site Fantasy Critic How to Play Fantasy Critic FAQ Open Critic Review Site
html:
Welcome to July!  I am couple days late on the usual weekly post, which I have done every Sunday up until this point, but I had places to be over the weekend, so some things fell by the wayside.  Also, the month in review post gets the last day of the month, so even though I was home yesterday, this post got pushed a day further.

Fantasy Critic League – Like Fantasy Football, but for Video Games

This past week saw the release of another big title, Death Stranding 2, a sequel to a popular and well regarded game.  So we get to see how a big sequel does.  But first, the scores as they stood at last check-in.

The Standings for Week 24

Okay, with that laid out, let’s look at what happened in week twenty-five.  A game shipped!

  • Death Stranding 2: On the Beach has released!
    • [Picked by Rodent Entertainment (Arhanta)]
    • Now has a score of 91.2

I had to mix up two updates to get that one just to show where the scoring started.  However, it saw a bit of decline not too far down the road.

  • Death Stranding 2: On the Beach
    • [Picked by Rodent Entertainment (Arhanta)]
    • Score has gone DOWN from 91.2 to 89.7

Still, that is an extremely solid score.  Arhanta was down in 10th spot with only two releases on the board, so that nearly 20 points was an automatic elevation.

  • Publisher Score Updates
  • Rodent Entertainment (Arhanta)
    • Score has gone UP from 14.5 to 35.2
    • Moved from 10th place to 7th place
  • Slightly Scuffed Studios (Kluwes)
    • Moved from 7th place to 8th place
  • TAGN HQ (Wilhelm)
    • Moved from 8th place to 9th place
  • Rusty Shackleford (Shilgrod)
    • Moved from 9th place to 10th place

That put Arhanta in seventh place, pushing three of us down the ranks and left the scoreboard looking like this at the end of the week.

The Standings for Week 25

Bhagpuss remains solidly in first place for now, with six solid picks and a counter pick that won’t hurt him.  The projections changed up a little bit.  Oddly, Arhanta got dinged a rank even as Death Stranding 2 delivered.  Part of me is as interested in how accurate the projections will end up being.

We also had some updates this week, with titles getting their releases pinned down.

  • Little Nightmares III
    • [Picked by Rodent Entertainment (Arhanta)]
    • Release date changed from ‘2025’ to ‘Friday, October 10, 2025’.
  • Chained Echoes: Ashes of Elrant
    • [Picked by Crash and Burn Games (Shawn)]
    • Release date changed from ‘Q2 2025’ to ‘Thursday, August 07, 2025’.

Always good to have a real release date.  However, the news wasn’t universally positive.

  • Dave the Diver – In the Jungle
    • [Picked by Rodent Entertainment (Arhanta)]
    • Estimated release date changed from ‘Late 2025’ to ‘Early 2026’.

That puts Dave the Diver out of the running for this year’s league.  Time to drop and pick something else.

Then we had one bid this week.

  • Keeper
    • Won by Hare Brained Schemes (p0tsh0t) with a bid of $11

Keeper has a mid-October release date.

With all of that, here is what is coming up.

Coming up for week 26

Basically, we’ve got nothing for the US Independence Day week.  So any score changes will be driven by reviews.  Expect next week’s update to be light unless we get a surprise.
